thread.title: Publisher cancels Milo Yiannopoulos book after he appeared to defend pedophilia
thread.title_full: Publisher cancels Milo Yiannopoulos book after he appeared to defend pedophilia | Washington Examiner

author: Caitlin Yilek
title: Publisher cancels Milo Yiannopoulos book after he appeared to defend pedophilia
text:
Simon & Schuster has canceled the publication of Milo Yiannopoulos' book "Dangerous" after he appeared to defend pedophilia in video clips that emerged on social media Sunday.
"After careful consideration, [Simon & Schuster and Threshold Editions] have cancelled publication of Dangerous by Milo Yiannopoulos," Adam Rothberg, the publisher's head of corporate communications, wrote on Twitter.
Statement: After careful consideration @simonschuster and its @threshold_books have cancelled publication of Dangerous by Milo Yiannopoulos— (((Adam Rothberg))) (@AdamRothberg) February 20, 2017 
Yiannopoulos confirmed the news in a Facebook post.
Stay abreast of the latest developments from nation's capital and beyond with curated News Alerts from the Washington Examiner news desk and delivered to your inbox.
  Washington Examiner News Alerts.   alert soon! "They canceled my book," he wrote.
Yiannopoulos' book deal was worth a reported $250,000 and was expected to be released in June.
"Dangerous" rose to No. 1 on Amazon in early February after critics threatened to boycott the publisher over the deal.
As of Monday evening it was No. 85 on the list of best-sellers, based on pre-orders.
Also from the Washington Examiner Republican bills to kill federal agencies face uphill battle Education Department, EPA and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau are each targeted.
By Daniel Chaitin • 02/20/17 5:04 PM Earlier Monday, the Conservative Political Action Conference rescinded its invitation to have Yiannopoulos speak at the event.
